title: Market Wrap, January 3: Bears gatecrash New Year party; SENSEX tanks 721 pts, NIFTY50 holds on to 24,000; oil & gas stocks shine - Upstox
Mahindra's SUV Sales Grow By 18% In Dec'24, Selling 41,424 Units - NDTV
summary:
Mahindra's SUV Sales Surge by 18% in December 2024, Reaching 41,424 Units

Date: January 25, 2025   Source: NDTV

Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. reported a significant growth in its auto sales for December 2024, particularly in the SUV segment.

  • Total auto sales for December 2024 reached 69,768 vehicles, a 16% increase.
  • SUV sales in the domestic market totaled 41,424 units, growing 18%.
  • The company's commercial vehicle sales reached 19,502 units.
  • Mahindra became the only Indian auto company on the Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) world leader status within the Auto Sector.
  • The new electric SUVs, BE 6 and XEV 9E, will soon start accepting orders.
“We sold 41,424 SUVs, a growth of 18% and 69,768 total vehicles, a growth of 16% in December.” - Veejay Nakra, President, Automotive Division, M&M Ltd.

The impressive sales growth and recognition in sustainability highlight Mahindra's commitment to innovation and market leadership in the automotive sector.
newTitle: Mahindra's SUV Sales Surge by 18% in December 2024, Reaching 41,424 Units

title: Top Gainers and Losers today on 3 January, 2025: Oil & Natural Gas Corporation, Tata Motors, Wipro, HDFC Bank among most active stocks; Check full list here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Top Gainers and Losers today on 3 January, 2025

Publication Date: January 3, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Today's financial markets experienced significant fluctuations, with the Nifty closing down by 0.76% and the Sensex down by 0.9%. The Nifty Midcap and Small Cap indices performed better than the Nifty 50 index.

Nifty Index Top Gainers and Losers Today

  • Top Gainers: Oil & Natural Gas Corporation (up 5.21%), Tata Motors (up 3.31%), Titan Company (up 1.85%), SBI Life Insurance Company (up 1.79%), Hindustan Unilever (up 1.53%).
  • Top Losers: Wipro (down 3.08%), HDFC Bank (down 2.48%), Tech Mahindra (down 2.17%), Adani Ports & Special Economic Zone (down 2.16%), ICICI Bank (down 1.98%).

Sensex Top Gainers and Losers

  • Top Gainers: Tata Motors (up 3.33%), Titan Company (up 1.70%), Hindustan Unilever (up 1.49%), Nestle India (up 1.47%), Reliance Industries (up 0.78%).
  • Top Losers: Wipro (down 3.03%), HDFC Bank (down 2.46%), Tech Mahindra (down 2.23%), Tata Consultancy Services (down 2.03%), ICICI Bank (down 1.97%).

Nifty MidCap 50 and Small Cap 100 Highlights

  • MidCap Gainers: UPL, SBI Cards & Payment Services, SRF, Yes Bank, APL Apollo Tubes.
  • MidCap Losers: Godrej Properties, Polycab India, KPIT Technologies, MRF, Aurobindo Pharma.

BSE and NSE Updates

BSE Top Gainers: Lloyds Metals & Energy (up 7.32%), Shyam Metalics & Energy (up 5.36%). BSE Top Losers: EIGHTY JEWELL-MT (down 8.22%).

NSE Top Gainers: Lloyds Metals & Energy (up 7.50%), Just Dial (up 5.42%). NSE Top Losers: Zomato (down 4.13%), Tanla Platforms (down 4.06%).

This report reflects market activity as of January 3, 2025.
newTitle: Top Gainers and Losers in the Stock Market on January 3, 2025

title: Gold price clings to gains ahead of US ISM Manufacturing PMI - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Price Clings to Gains Ahead of US ISM Manufacturing PMI

Publication Date: December 01, 2024 | Source: FXStreet

Gold prices are showing a steady increase ahead of the US ISM Manufacturing PMI data for December, supported by safe-haven flows due to geopolitical tensions.

  • Gold prices are influenced by Joe Biden's discussions regarding Iran’s nuclear facilities.
  • The US Dollar Index is trading near a multi-year high, which may limit gold's price increases.
  • Gold's appeal is aided by subdued US Treasury bond yields.
  • In 2024, gold has seen over 27% gains, marking its best annual return since 2010 due to ongoing geopolitical conflicts.
"The Manufacturing PMI is seen steady at 48.4, suggesting that activities contracted at a steady pace."

The ongoing changes in policies in both China and the US may further impact the gold market, with potential interest rate cuts from China and a cautious approach by the Federal Reserve signaling varying influences on gold prices.
newTitle: Gold Price Gains Amid Geopolitical Tensions and Upcoming Economic Data

title: Low-tech end to white-collar crime—how SEBI caught Ketan Parekh’s latest stock market fraud - ThePrint
summary:
Low-tech end to white-collar crime—how SEBI caught Ketan Parekh’s latest stock market fraud

Publication Date: New Delhi, Date Not Specified, Source: Not Specified

India’s stock market regulator has again found Ketan Parekh, the infamous stock broker previously imprisoned and banned from the markets for one of the country’s biggest stock market scams during the turn of the century, to be the lynchpin of yet another case of stock market illegality.

  • SEBI passed an interim order against Parekh, stating he transferred non-public information (NPI) to partners for illegal profits.
  • Through investigation, SEBI froze assets worth Rs 65.77 crore from 22 entities, including Parekh.
  • SEBI discovered front-running activities involving a US-based foreign portfolio investor referred to as ‘Big Client’.
  • Parekh and others used pseudonyms to communicate, leading to the illicit execution of trades.
“It was noted that the birth date of Ketan Parekh as mentioned on his PAN Card is also February 15, 1962.”

SEBI utilized call detail records, travel data, and other evidence to confirm Parekh's involvement and solidify their findings.
newTitle: SEBI Uncovers Ketan Parekh's Stock Market Fraud Using Low-Tech Methods

title: Suzlon Share Price: Clarification issued after Material Price Movement - Stock to BUY in 2025? Check target - ET Now
summary:

Date: Updated Jan 3, 2025
Source: ET Now News

Suzlon Energy started the New Year on a high note but faced a setback shortly after. Following a significant upgrade from CRISIL Ratings, clarifications were made regarding recent price movements.

  • Suzlon shares rose significantly on January 1, 2025, before experiencing a downward trend in subsequent trading sessions.
  • The stock slipped by 1.50 percent as of January 3, trading at Rs 61.96.
  • CRISIL Ratings upgraded Suzlon's credit rating to 'CRISIL A' with a positive outlook.
  • Suzlon Energy addressed a material price movement (MPM) noticed on January 1, without identifying a specific cause for the movement.
  • Market analysts suggest holding onto the stock with targets set between Rs 70-80 in the near term.
Sachin Gupta of 5paisa advises a HOLD position with a stop loss of Rs 57.

Suzlon Energy has shown remarkable performance in the renewable energy sector, delivering returns of 63% in the past year alone.

title: Stock Market Today: Nifty, Sensex Snap Two-Day Gaining Streak; Wipro, HDFC Bank Top Losers - NDTV Profit
summary:
Stock Market Today: Nifty, Sensex Snap Two-Day Gaining Streak; Wipro, HDFC Bank Top Losers

Date: 03 Jan 2025 | Source: NDTV Profit

The Nifty 50 and Sensex ended 0.76% and 0.90% down, respectively on Friday, snapping their two-day winning streak due to declines in private bank stocks.

  • The Nifty 50 declined by 199.60 points or 0.83% to close at 23,989.05.
  • The Sensex dropped by 784.00 points or 0.98% to 79,159.71.
  • Wipro Ltd. and HDFC Bank Ltd. were the top losers of the day.
  • The market saw a mixed performance with six sectors ending higher and six lower.
  • The broader market showed resilience with midcap and smallcap indices performing better than the benchmarks.
The Nifty 50 and Sensex gained 0.80% and 0.67%, respectively, in the week ended on Jan 3.

This market activity highlights the volatility influenced by the performance of key private banks, demonstrating the ongoing fluctuations within the Indian stock market.

title: Maruti e Vitara new teaser reveals interior details and features - CarWale
India's IPO boom created seven billionaires in 2024; Find out who they are - CNBCTV18
summary:
India's IPO Boom Creates Seven New Billionaires in 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: CNBCTV18.com

In a remarkable year for Initial Public Offerings (IPOs), India saw seven entrepreneurs gain billionaire status, largely from the renewable energy sector.

  • Record-breaking IPO year in 2024 raised ₹1.66 lakh crore, nearly three times the previous year.
  • The new billionaires include founders from various sectors: renewable energy, healthcare, automation, and liquor.
  • Waaree Energies valued at $10.6 billion made Hitesh C Doshi and family the wealthiest among the group with a net worth of $7.1 billion.
  • Premier Energies' Chiranjiv Singh Saluja saw his net worth rise to $4.7 billion from a market value of $7.3 billion.
  • Billionaires from Ola Electric, Emcure Pharmaceuticals, Acme Solar Holdings, Jyoti CNC Automation, and Allied Blenders & Distillers also joined the ranks.
  • Approximately 85 companies are expected to list in 2025, targeting ₹1.53 lakh crore.
"A strong potential for India’s IPO market is expected to continue with the anticipated influx of listings in various sectors."

In conclusion, the Indian IPO landscape has significantly propelled local entrepreneurs into billionaire status, showcasing the robust growth potential of various industries, especially renewable energy.
newTitle: India's IPO Boom Creates Seven New Billionaires in 2024

title: Mainboard IPOs in December 2024: A mixed trend for newly listed stocks, a look at top 5 performers - Upstox
summary:
Mainboard IPOs in December 2024: A mixed trend for newly listed stocks, a look at top 5 performers

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Upstox

The last month of 2024 was a busy period for primary market investors with 30 mainboard and SME IPOs launched in December, raising nearly ₹1.9 crore. 15 mainboard IPOs were listed, with a positive trend as 13 stocks traded higher than their IPO prices.

  1. Mamata Machinery had a stellar debut, listing at ₹600 against an issue price of ₹243, currently trading at ₹545, up 133.41% from its IPO.
  2. One MobiKwik Systems debuted at ₹440, significantly rising above its issue price of ₹279, currently trading at ₹602.
  3. Unimech Aerospace listed at ₹1,460, down to ₹1,429.95, maintaining a gain of 85.62% from its issue price of ₹785.
  4. Transrail Lighting debuted at ₹590 and is currently trading at ₹626.55, reflecting a near 49% gain.
  5. Senores Pharmaceuticals is trading at ₹577.5, up 46.52% from its issue price of ₹391.

While Suraksha Diagnostic and Carraro India posted negative returns, the rest showed gains of over 40%.

"The stock positioning in the industry indicates potential further price appreciation for various companies."

Overall, December saw a trending positive for newly listed stocks, suggesting a robust appetite for IPOs despite some fluctuations.
newTitle: Mainboard IPOs in December 2024: A Mixed Trend for Newly Listed Stocks

title: Bajaj Housing shares may dive 21%, believes Kotak Equities. Initiates coverage with Rs 100 target - The Economic Times
summary:
Kotak Equities Predicts 21% Drop in Bajaj Housing Shares with Sell Rating

Publication Date: N/A

Source: ETMarkets.com

Kotak Institutional Equities has initiated a "sell" rating on Bajaj Housing Finance, indicating a potential 21% downside due to high valuations. They project a 25% earnings growth over FY2024-27E, but note risks from competition and rising rates.

  • Kotak initiates coverage with target price of Rs 100.
  • Current stock price suggests a 21% downside risk.
  • Expected earnings growth of 25% CAGR over FY2024-27E.
  • Stable margins and moderate RoE projected due to rising rates.
  • Strong asset quality noted with low NPLs.
  • Key risks include competition and interest rate movements.
“Bajaj Housing Finance trades rich (4.7X book and 39X earnings FY2026E), posing downside risk (21% to our FV of Rs100) and drives our SELL rating,” said Kotak Equities.

In conclusion, despite strong growth projections, Bajaj Housing Finance faces challenges that could impact its performance in the near term.
newTitle: Kotak Equities Predicts 21% Drop in Bajaj Housing Shares with Sell Rating

title: Big Order Win: Stock makes new post-listing high post ₹1,085 crore order from DRDO - CNBCTV18
summary:
Afcons Infrastructure Secures ₹1,085 Crore Order from DRDO

Date: January 3, 2024 | Source: CNBC-TV18

Afcons Infrastructure Ltd., a newly listed entity of the Shapoorji Pallonji Group, witnessed a 6.5% increase in stock price after announcing a significant order from the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO).

  • The order, worth ₹1,085 crore inclusive of GST, involves enhancements to the Maritime Theatre Command (MTC) and developing workshop equipment for the shiplift facility in Visakhapatnam.
  • Afcons will handle civil, mechanical, electrical, HVAC, ELV systems, and interior design related to the project.
  • The project is to be completed within a period exceeding 36 months.
  • As of September, the company reported order inflows totaling ₹19,000 crore and anticipates an additional ₹5,000 crore.
  • The company’s total order book stood at over ₹34,000 crore as of September 2024.
“In Maharashtra, over the last one year or so, they have done bidding of ₹60,000-70,000 crore, and we have bagged close to ₹8,000-10,000 crore, where we have already received the order, or we are L1 (lowest bidder),” said Jha.

The announcement has significantly boosted Afcons’ stock, which reached a new post-listing high.
newTitle: Afcons Infrastructure Secures ₹1,085 Crore Order from DRDO

title: ITI Ltd shares soar over 13%, hit new record high in intraday trade - The Economic Times

Shares of ITI Ltd, an enterprise under the Department of Telecommunications, experienced a significant rise of 13.5% in intraday trade, reaching an all-time high of Rs 432.45.

  • Market capitalization of ITI Ltd stood at Rs 41,029.87 crore.
  • The stock has been on an upward trend since October 2024, rebounding from a low of Rs 210.
  • Shares increased by 37.3% over the past year and surged by 66.5% in the last 3 months.
“Technically, the stock is positioned well above all significant short, medium, and long-term moving averages.”

In summary, ITI Ltd's stock has shown substantial growth and consistent upward movement, making it a noteworthy company in the telecommunications sector.

title: ITC share price dips ahead of ITC Hotels demerger record date. Should you buy? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
ITC Share Price Dips Ahead of ITC Hotels Demerger Record Date

Publication Date: January 5, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

ITC share price dropped over one percent as the company approaches its demerger record date set for January 6. Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 ITC shares held.

  • ITC's share price fell on January 5, 2024.
  • The demerger record date is January 6, 2024, making it the last chance for investors to buy ITC shares to receive ITC Hotels shares.
  • The demerger ratio is 1:10, meaning for every 10 ITC shares held, investors will receive 1 ITC Hotels share.
  • The special trading session to determine ITC Hotels' share price will occur on January 6.
  • Analysts suggest the current dip could be a buying opportunity for long-term investment.
“Buying ITC shares ahead of the demerger record date could be a good opportunity for long-term investors.” - Akriti Mehrotra, Research Analyst, StoxBox

The dmeger is expected to enhance ITC’s capital efficiency and profitability, particularly in the hotel and FMCG sectors.
newTitle: ITC Share Price Dips Ahead of ITC Hotels Demerger Record Date

Nita Ambani, during the 25th anniversary event of the Jamnagar refinery, shared her heartfelt sentiments regarding the place’s significance to the Ambani family, honoring Dhirubhai Ambani and expressing gratitude to her mother-in-law, Kokilaben Ambani.

title: Vishal Mega Mart, V2 Retail, other retail stocks surge as DMart’s Q3 update sparks optimism among peers - Moneycontrol
summary:
Vishal Mega Mart, V2 Retail, other retail stocks surge as DMart’s Q3 update sparks optimism among peers

Date: January 03, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Shares of various retail companies rose sharply on January 3 after DMart released a positive update for Q3, boosting market sentiment across the sector.

  • Vishal Mega Mart, V2 Retail, and Baazar Style Retail saw significant stock price increases.
  • DMart reported a standalone revenue increase of 17.5 percent year-on-year to Rs 15,565.23 crore.
  • V2 Retail's revenue grew by 58 percent year-on-year with a Same Store Sales Growth of nearly 25 percent.
  • V-Mart Retail had a 16 percent revenue increase in the December quarter.
“Avenue Supermart's update for the October-December period brought a lot of cheer to the markets.”

The Q3 updates from DMart and its peers have led to renewed optimism among investors in the retail sector.
newTitle: Retail Stocks Surge on DMart's Positive Q3 Update
